website_summaries.verdict: Fast and affordable, the Seagate Backup Plus/Slim is one of the best deals on the market if you want want lots of storage space on the go.
pros: The fast and affordable Seagate Backup Plus/Slim has the highest capacity of any portable drive
The drive includes helpful backup software and a free two-year 200GB subscription to Microsoft OneDrive online storage
cons: The two-year warranty is short and there's no security option to protect the contents of the drive against unauthorized access

customer_reviews.title: Broke within 2 weeks. Would not recommend
customer_reviews.text: I bought it about a 2 weeks ago. Worked fine at first. Then today it stopped working. Wouldn't show up on my computer when plugged in and started making clicking noise. I would advise you NOT purchase this product as it has the potential to literally ruin your life. I had transferred childhood videos on there. Gone. Now Seagate tells me it costs $550 to recover lost data when it was their faulty piece of hardware that shot itself in the foot. Will NEVER buy this product again. If you are set on a Seagate External Hard drive, do yourself a favor and buy the 2 or 4 year recovery plan. I should have done that.
customer_reviews.author: PLund60

customer_reviews.title: Shipped in a paper mailer -- it arrived with several hardware defects. It's being returned.
customer_reviews.text: This 5TB hard drive was shipped in a paper mailer (with no internal protection). (see photo). (Delivered by our latest new delivery option -- which I would like a way to avoid.) Gone are the days when these would come ship boxed and padded. Expectedly, drive tests on this (see photos) resulted in errors showing up on the drive. Note: This cooked along at 124 degrees (51 Celsius) when in use. A 4TB WD is at 45 C. As it is for customer data backups, this can not be relied upon long term. Hey Seagate -- what will be the impact on your support costs as these things are shipped in paper mailers? It's being returned.
customer_reviews.author: Web Developer

customer_reviews.title: A real SATA internal drive inside this USB external drive.
customer_reviews.text: So far, so good. I bought this because I had some Citibank Visa points about to expire, but I'm glad I did. This Seagate USB drive contains a SATA inside, unlike such drives from WD and Toshiba, which are exclusively USB. That means if the USB portion fails, with the Seagate I can simply remove the internal drive and recover its data by connecting to a common SATA port, at a cost of no more than about $35, rather than pay a data recovery company hundreds or thousands. That may not seem important, but all of my drive failures over the past 20 years have been related to failure of the USB connector or USB-SATA adapter electronics.
customer_reviews.author: Nick Nameless

customer_reviews.title: Love the hard drive
customer_reviews.text: Love the hard drive! Although, a big con for me was the set up - it had me download 2 installations but I'm not sure how necessary it was to do so. And then eventually, I saw that you could just "erase" the hard drive, rename it, and that's when you can finally start to drag and drop what ever file you'd like. I thought it was just something that I could just plug in and use as advertised, but you only get to that point after the set up. Other than that, it's fast, quick and easy! Super light and small as well!
customer_reviews.author: JustAnotherPersonTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Quick working in less than year- lost everything
customer_reviews.text: Bought this in Jan 2018 and started not working properly and making noises in Nov. I took to my trusted computer repair shop and they couldn't salvage it, but recommended a data recovery company. Called them and will cost minimum of $700 for partial recovery all the way up to $1,500 for full recovery. Computer store said do not get anything higher than the 2T. I just lost about 20 years of photos. I can piece some of it together from online albums. I am shocked that I didn't even get 11 mos out of this drive and what is worse is that I paid $100 to lose everything.
customer_reviews.author: Mama in Messiah

customer_reviews.title: complete junk - died with a month's use and Seagate doesnt care
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this drive on Sep. 25, 2017 from Amazon. It died 11/14/17. It squeals and the data i no longer have access to may not be recoverable. On the phone with Seagate now. I have bought their products in the past and trusted their name. It's $599 for cloud recovery or $699 for a new hard drive with my data on it. Do not buy this piece of crap. I think they want to sell their recovery service and sell bad products to get your money that way. Seagate is on my never again list, and should be on yours
customer_reviews.author: thiedes

customer_reviews.title: CRAP CRAP CRAP CRAP CRAP CRAP CRAP!!
customer_reviews.text: Took perfect care of this drive. Unplugged it the correct way using the usual USB disconnect. I switch between my desktop or laptop often. I only had it one month, and today, I go to plug it in my laptop, power my unit on, and it can't read the drive. It is recommended to do a tools/repair. I proceed, then wind up getting access denied. I have to redo the security options just to get frigging access. Now that I have access, half my important data is GONE. Seagate Drives are the McDonalds of external HD's. Never never EVER again with these welfare level drives. 2 DAYS after Amazon's return window is up. You suck Seagate!!!!
customer_reviews.author: JC

customer_reviews.title: Dead not yet six months after receiving it. I rarely use it.  Sometimes you get a bad one.
customer_reviews.text: I just got it October 2017 and it died mid-March 2018. A Buffalo 1TB portable hard drive that's been reliable for 5 1/2 years (Oct 2012) died at the same time. I'd blame it on the power surge/outage from the big winter storm that fried two digital lamp timers, four surge protectors and my Samsung 40" TV but neither portable external hard drive was plugged in. Can a hard drive go bad from electrical charges in the air? This is a top-two-rated portable external hard drive so I'm trying it again but I'm getting the Data Recovery Plan this time. I also just got a Western Digital 4TB portable hard drive (and data recovery plan) as well.
customer_reviews.author: D-Walker

customer_reviews.title: FAILED SEAGATE
customer_reviews.text: My drive is barely 4 months old. I have a case for it. It remains inside and is used 2-3 times a month for transferring photos and documents from my PC. It no longer is recognized by my computer and when I plug it in, it makes a chirping sound. I am unable to access anything on my drive. I have over 10 years of photos, documents, and files on here and am extremely dissatisfied. Seagate is supposed to be reliable and clearly, not the type of external hard drive anyone would want.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: 6 months anddddd it's a brick....
customer_reviews.text: After 6 months the hard drive has died. I was using it as an Xbox One storage was was working fine until today. I have tried countless fixes for hours but it won't read on Xbox or any computer suddenly even though it powers up. I will now have to download over a TB of data and am out a hard drive. Goodbye Seagate, maybe warranty your product and stand by it....
customer_reviews.author: Jack Donnelly

customer_reviews.title: Not Worth The Trouble
customer_reviews.text: Box it came in said there was backup software included and there was none. Each time I raised that issue with Seagate tech support, it was ignored. Seagate Seatools quickly found the Seagate hard drive. Seagate dashboard could not find this external hard drive and their tech support could not figure out why. Seagate toolkit had to be downloaded and would not install properly. Each time you clicked on its icon, it would reinstall the program rather than open it. Some portions of their software are not compatible with Windows 10 !!
customer_reviews.author: Gary K

customer_reviews.title: Failed on the 3rd use. Seagate replaced with a REFURB unit!
customer_reviews.text: I use this drive for a backup from my desktop (after all, the product is called "Backup Plus". I only plug this into my PC once every 2 to 3 months to do a backup copy from my PC to this this drive... about 280 GB of data. This was the 3rd time performing that backup when this drive failed. You can hear it clicking over and over again. During the file copy, the drive became unresponsive. I found out it was it was still under Seagate's 2-year warranty, so I filled out the form online and shipped the drive back to Seagate per their instructions. They sent back a "RECERTIFIED" unit. What kind of a warranty is that?
customer_reviews.author: SJhiker

customer_reviews.title: Fails under loads such as large backup
customer_reviews.text: I ordered two. One arrived DOA and then second 'worked' as long as it was not placed under a significant sustained load of writing... which is the ONE thing I'd expect to do to a "Backup Plus Slim 2TB Portable External Hard Drive".
customer_reviews.author: John Winans

customer_reviews.title: Xbox One? So far so good...
customer_reviews.text: I'm using this for my Xbox One. The XB1 only came with 500 Gb of memory, which is pathetic. Adding 2 Tb (actually 1.8) helps a lot. You just plug the USB into the back of your Xbox, wait for the format screen to come up, let it format, and you're good to go. So far I've been using this as my default memory for both downloading and playing games, and I haven't noticed any problems at all. I'm withholding judgment until I see how this thing does for the long haul, but for now I am really pleased with it.
customer_reviews.author: The Cool Guy

customer_reviews.title: Expect it to last from 8-13 months.
customer_reviews.text: I guess I failed to read the reviews on the durability of this External Hard Drive. It lasted me about a year and well I always made sure to safely eject it. I never dropped it, never let it heat up, or scratched it, and one day it just stopped working. I had about 700GB worth of important files. I contacted Seagate and well their customer service was amazing and understanding but mentioned two things: This is an expected problem with this device, in regards to power issues and no longer properly functioning. It cost $500-$660 to recover your lost information, and to receive and new device. I think I will rather stick to WD or other External Hard Drives.
customer_reviews.author: Sam perdomo

customer_reviews.title: Works great, no problems after a full month of heavy use.
customer_reviews.text: Copying copious amount of data - having read many reviews before purchasing this. I've had no problems copying, editing material copied, playing back, opening and reviewing. Managing versions with this external drive. I've been using it for over a month and have about 30% of it filled. It is powered by USB port so no need to drag extra power supply like older drives of comparable size. I did buy a dedicated cooling table - it got warm, but not hot - other reviews were very helpful in making their case that no electronics like to get hot. I just bought a second one for another purpose - I have high confidence in the device and the technology.
customer_reviews.author: Capt

customer_reviews.title: Dead on arrival, have sent it back and they are sending a replacement. (REPLACEMENT WORKS GREAT)
customer_reviews.text: was broken on arrival - just a high pitched sound emanating from it and computer not recognizing it at all.Lets see what the replacement behaves like. I have always used only seagate external drives so am completely shocked that something so defective got sent out! UPDATE Dec 6 - the replacement arrived promptly and is working. I don't know how to check bad sectors etc, but it just very quickly copied the 1 Tb backup that I needed.
customer_reviews.author: Vina

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed/limited customer support from Seagate
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed in Seagate. I own several Seagate drives one that is nearly 5 yrs old and is still working well. I have tried several times to contact Seagate support with no results. The software is limited and full of bugs with Windows 10. At this time until Seagate backs up this product I cannot recommend this product to anyone. Shipping was great, package very well, doesn't look damage in any way. Windows 10 will not recognize the drive despite all of Seagate website support. Still trying to get a RMA from Seagate to replace the drive.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: usless garbage
customer_reviews.text: Didn't auto-run from the start. On-line & phone support total idiots. Found the program on-line, loaded it, plugged it in and it ran for 24 hours saying 6 seconds left. Gave up but checked the drive. It said almost 2 TB of data stored. Funny I only have a 500gig with 80% free. Tried to read segate drive on another computer with same results: says it's full but can't read files. Finally tested drive in back yard with sledge hammer. Was able to reduce it to dust. Why? because I strongly suspect it was a "mouse trap". I return it and my data is stolen. I wouldn't buy a paperweight from these guys.
customer_reviews.author: cruncher

customer_reviews.title: Can't Give 0 Stars!!
customer_reviews.text: Don't buy! Died in less than two months!! Unbelievable and then wanted met to exchange for a new one when old one has all my personal information on it! NOT!! They sent out a new one anyway and then if I didn't return by a certain time they would charge me for the second one, so the new one went back! Don't bother!! Will never by Seagate again!
customer_reviews.author: Debbie

customer_reviews.title: external stopped working
customer_reviews.text: well, after using it for several months it completely stopped working. Mind you I am a photographer that relied on this technology for storing precious photos. I have contacted computer repair places and they are willing to try to retrieve the photos for $175, which I don't have. I won't be purchasing another seagate product ever again.
customer_reviews.author: Samantha

customer_reviews.title: It’s a terribly unreliable drive.
customer_reviews.text: Unbelievable how unreliable this drive is. 5 months old and it has kicked the bucket. It was always placed in a hard case and I never traveled with it. Really upset that it’s not working. The data on the drive is backed up elsewhere but to know that money has went to the toilet on this thing is the really sad part. Never again with seagate. Nope
customer_reviews.author: JayVee

customer_reviews.title: Please read before you buy!!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased in March of 2016 as a gift to my daughter to store pictures of my grandkids. In October of 2017, after my daughter had stored all of her pictures, the drive became unresponsive. Seagate offered to replace the hardware, but only after my daughter pays $300-$600 to recover the digital files. If you want to protect your digital property, this is NOT the product for you.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Pure Trash; Avoid at all costs
customer_reviews.text: I just got this. Registered it. Plugged in to move files over to start saving. Failed to recognize device twice. Each time it failed, it would then remove all existence of a portal drive. The light would be on showing it's connected. But I have to restart my computer for it acknowledge that there is a connected device. On each attempt, 1 or 2 files will start to come over and then it fails instantly and gives messages such as the destination does not exist. But of course it does, because Im moving stuff on to an about 4.87 TB free device. Look elsewhere for external storage. Worst garbage I've ever bought. Too bad you can't leave 0 stars.
customer_reviews.author: rodrigo mena

customer_reviews.title: Drive failed - lost everything
customer_reviews.text: Do not buy unless you don’t care about losing all of your data after only a few uses. Transferred all of my songs, projects and pictures from my laptop, after only a few uses the drive beeped and stopped working. Seagate does not stand behind their products, but so kindly offered to help recover the data for $500+. Ouch. Avoid Seagate and this product if you value your files
customer_reviews.author: KG

customer_reviews.title: Not reliable at this size unless you have multiples backed up as mirrors.
customer_reviews.text: Bought 2 of these. One is still going, but making weird clicking noise. The other died after only 4 no months. Luckily I am using them as mirrors to each other, so I have all my data. Do not use just one of these drives for a lot of data. Must have at least 2. Also... Not a bad idea to keep one "air gapped" meaning, unplugged and updated on a schedule. This is a good thing in case of corruption or ransomware so you do not synchronize or mirror bad data overwriting your good data.
customer_reviews.author: Mark A. Caswell

customer_reviews.title: Another quick to fail Seagate drive
customer_reviews.text: I bought this drive on August 9th 2016 and now on November 21, 2016 the drive is starting to make crackling noises when it's connected to a computer. I've had Seagate drives fail on me quickly in the past but this way too fast. Less than 3 months and the drive is failing? Unnaceptable.
customer_reviews.author: Luxbrands

customer_reviews.title: Broke after 6 months.
customer_reviews.text: After having this product since January (it’s now July) it is no longer working. I bought it for a backup on my ps4. It’s making wierd noises and is not being recognized by any device. The hard drive has not moved in 6 month since I took it out of the box and connected it. No damage has occurred at all. It’s just stopped working. I would not buy again and will stick to my passports since I have had 4 of those for the past 5 years. It is still under warrenty so I will still try and return it.
customer_reviews.author: Natalie

customer_reviews.title: Literally has RUINED my life.
customer_reviews.text: WHY ISN’T THERE A ZERO???? I have had this since Sept 12th. I put EVERYTHING from 20 years on here and now it has mechanical failure and I can send it to Seagate and for 49.99 they will see if they can recover my data, IF they can, they want $650 more dollars to do so. Since I was in process of organizing, this was my only back up. I have literally lost EVERYTHING. A novel, a screen play, thousands of pictures.
customer_reviews.author: Heatherbeee

customer_reviews.title: This drive failed after 10 days and lost data.
customer_reviews.text: This hard drive worked for exactly 1 week and 3 days before it stopped working altogether. All my trusted backup data from my Apple computer is gone. Well, not all of it but some valuable files are gone. I don't know what to do. Buy a replacement and possible suffer the same fate in two more weeks? I've lost all faith in what I thought was a reputable drive manufacturer...Seagate.
customer_reviews.author: Gary

customer_reviews.title: Received this first of February 2017. Already not working ...
customer_reviews.text: Received this first of February 2017. Already not working by April 5, 2017. Piece of junk. No children in home, not mistreated in any way. Return window ended March 1st, and tech support ended March 31st, 2017 so I guess I'm just stuck. I wish I had bought this at a local brick and mortar store. I could have taken it in locally and received some help then. Now I just flushed eighty bucks down the drain!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Miller

customer_reviews.title: Short lifespan
customer_reviews.text: This drive failed on me in under 2 years. It was set up as a macOS Time Machine backup drive, so aside from the initial backup it should not have seen excessive usage making the early failure something reasonable to expect. In 2014 I bought a similar portable, external drive made by Western Digital and it's still working to this day. To be fair, I've had issues with some desktop WD drives in the past as well. Hard drives are essentially gambling. Two stars because it did last two years and seemed to work fine for that timeframe.
customer_reviews.author: George Coghill

customer_reviews.title: Do Not Buy...
customer_reviews.text: I used this 2-3 times to back up family pictures and photo shoots. Then it started making a weird sound, like it was trying to start up. Never dropped it. Always in a case. I called a data recovery service. They said if it was just a stuck head, $150 fee. Well, after further research, it was a whole replacement of the head and must be taken into a lab... $600-$1700!! I said, “no, thanks.” Just recovered files from my laptop instead. What a POS. NEVER BUYING SEAGATE AGAIN. Lesson... back up your back ups!!
customer_reviews.author: Rachael702

customer_reviews.title: WORST DRIVE EVER!!! WASTE OF MONEY!!! TERRIBLE EXPERIENCE WITH 3 DRIVES!!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: WORST DRIVE EVER! DO NOT BUY!!!!!!! I'm currently on my 3rd replacement in just a few months. These drives are terrible!!! All of them have failed on me or did not work from the start! I WILL NEVER BUY SEAGATE AGAIN!!!!!!!! Seagate will not refund my money so I'm stuck with a useless piece of plastic or I can keep returning them (for the 4th time....). I have a 2017 MBP and I keep several backups of my data at all times. I have a WD drive that has worked for years so I guess I'm buying only WD drives from now on. WARNING!!! DO NOT WASTE YOUR MONEY ON THIS HORRIBLE PRODUCT!!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: MES1088

customer_reviews.title: Still going strong after 2 years of almost everyday use
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this hard drive for two years exactly and it's still going strong. The past year, I've been using it almost daily and have no problems with it slowing down or messing up at all. I'm a travel blogger so I have a ton of photos and it's able to handle moving large amounts of data without a problem. I've dropped it a couple of times and don't eject it before taking the hard drive out sometimes, and it still works fine. I should probably stop doing that though... Anyways, I recommend buying it! I have the 2TB one.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Kim | Travel & Lifestyle

customer_reviews.title: Good til it isn't
customer_reviews.text: Had no issues with it. Bought in Oct '17. Died of natural causes in March '19. The drive had been plugged in and nothing changed at all within that time frame. It sat on the same solid location, was not near any other electronic device. 3 days ago, it pretended to be disconnected until I unplugged it and plugged it back in. I did that 3 times and then it decided it had taken its last breath. Thankfully the files were backed up on cloud but still... the hassle.
customer_reviews.author: P. Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Total Junk
customer_reviews.text: Trip to Europe and Morocco over the summer and uploaded photos from Macbook. Upon return less than 5 months later..no photos. Drive crashed and customer service is non existant. Will never buy Seagate products again
customer_reviews.author: PAUL FINDLAY

customer_reviews.title: Deader Than Dead
customer_reviews.text: Worked fine, but suddenly started beeping and isn’t fully recognized by computer anymore. It’ll show up in devices but not in file explorer, and the beeping noise is constant. Not worth it, can’t even rely on this to back up my media or games library.
customer_reviews.author: idleRush

customer_reviews.title: Hit or miss on quality
customer_reviews.text: I bought one, I liked it and it appeared to work well (still is). Bought another a few months later and as of a few days ago, it is no longer recognized by any computers I attach it to, so I can not get any of my data off of it. Useless. Very gunshy with Seagate now, although the alternatives are slim.
customer_reviews.author: Rich_CNY

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight, amazing 4TB capacity, small footprint, decent write speeds.
customer_reviews.text: I'm still baffled to carry 4TB in such a small package, best price out there, I got 100MBs sequential write speeds on it on an USB 3.0 port copying from an SSD. Decent speed, I am happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Liviu C.

customer_reviews.title: Already stopped working, terrible purchase
customer_reviews.text: I've used this ONCE. Backed up my computer and spent hours downloading years of photos onto it. It now only beeps. My computer doesn't even recognize it. I'm assuming the motor heads are stuck. This was already an expensive purchase for me - now I have to pay to get it fixed or fork out the money for a completely new hard drive. It has been sitting in my desk totally undisturbed for two months since used and this is what happens. Luckily I didn't delete anything I saved onto it from my computer! Very annoyed.
customer_reviews.author: oliviah_bshoppin

customer_reviews.title: Dead after 19 months. Buy WD instead.
customer_reviews.text: What can I say? I have 4 WD and 2 Seagate. Both Seagate crashed/died/expired. This was the second and last Seagate ever I bought. The other one was a GoPlus, also dead, barely outside warranty. Hope I get a replacement for this so I can sell it someplace else. TERRIBLE! This is no joke, it is a 5TB HD and these should not fail at this rate. Sure I have a second HD because HDs fail, but this is just terrible.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. No

customer_reviews.title: Mine lasted 4+ years.
customer_reviews.text: I used this disk for a Time Machine local backup for 4 years, 4 months, and then it failed to be recognized. I put the disk into another enclosure just to verify that it wasn't the USB to SATA converter, but the disk is dead. I think 4 years is a decent life for a disk that is often packed off in a laptop bag and shuffled around a desk. The internal drive was ST1000LM024 Seagate/Samsung. My replacement purchase has a bit larger case and perhaps more robust for packing on the road. If it lasted until I died, I'd give it 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: StonyRiverDave

customer_reviews.title: It failed
customer_reviews.text: Very, Very disappointing. For 14 months I happily backed up my computer to this twice a month, then my internal hard drive in my laptop died. I bought a new laptop and proceeded to restore from the Seagate external. It died while trying to restore. This thing gave me a false sense of security for over a year. Seagate says they have a $599.00 plan to recover my data after I send it in. What a rip off. They sell you a drive for $60.00. Then when you need it you have to pay them $600.00 to get your files. No more Seagate for me.
customer_reviews.author: R L Gilmore

customer_reviews.title: I quit.
customer_reviews.text: Doesn't work. This is my 4th Seagate in a row with problems. I'm done. At least the other 3 worked for a while before they croaked. This one won't work out of the box. My computer said this was set up for Windows, did I want to erase it. I said no, because I saw that there was a MAC program on the hard drive. The program doesn't work, other than registering the drive 5 times! I should have let Apple software manage this drive instead of the Seagate program. I'd say that I'll know for next time, but with this many problems, any future problems that I have will be with a different brand. I quit.
customer_reviews.author: Sigel

customer_reviews.title: harddrive broke down after a year of usage
customer_reviews.text: Ive bought this external harddrive specifically for my ps4. Ive had this for over a year, since september 2017. On this day of November 11, 2018, it has finally died on me and all my ps4 games are on this harddrive. Hopefully, seagates takes this comment into consideration to make a long lasting harddrive, because ive got some games to redownload!
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: Buy only if you want to waste your time and money.
customer_reviews.text: This drive took hours to complete a backup and then went on a continuous loop until it filled itself up. Leaving it plugged in froze my computer to the point where I had to do a hard reset, which triggered a "windows didn't load" error and another reboot. Downloaded the diagnostic from Seagate and THAT malfunctioned because it couldn't find anything in my CD drive. And then it froze the computer, but not before triggering Windows Defender. It's under warranty but to return it, Seagate wants very specific packaging and they have a 20-page file to describe it. They include a link to purchase the packaging from a third party. Like the drive, the link doesn't work.
customer_reviews.author: Lostinabook

customer_reviews.title: seemed fine, Feb 3rd
customer_reviews.text: received product Dec 22, seemed fine, Feb 3rd, stopped connecting to PS4, which it was bought to be a external hard drive for, when went to return it, discovered the return window expired Jan 31. Tried going online for fix it ideas, such as connecting to laptop and reformatting, none worked. Pretty crappy product, super waste of money, almost like it was programmed to stop functioning the minute the return window expired. It was a xmas present for my son, so very frustrating.
customer_reviews.author: cmiller

customer_reviews.title: Software Sucks Memory
customer_reviews.text: With respect to the unit's ability do perform in its intended function, I'm not upset that my computer hasn't crashed in order to test it. If it functions as a storage device, I can appreciate how compact it is and that it doesn't require another power source (i.e. yet another power cord in the rat's nest). On the not so great side, when it runs a backup, the software sucks memory to the extent that my reasonably robust desktop is rendered useless. It's easy to build in a workaround and schedule the backup to take place while you're sleeping, but it's still inconvenient.
customer_reviews.author: Sean Riley

customer_reviews.title: Slow Customer Service; Faulty Drive; No data recovery Warranty
customer_reviews.text: Has worked well and so far still works - but the cord has stopped working rendering the drive useless until I'm able to get a replacement. The drive is small in size, a nice weight and not too loud UPDATE/EDIT: revised to one star because the drive actually did fail (9 months old) after experiencing no impact or drop. Senates customer service team is extremely slow to respond; while they did offer to replace the drive because it’s within warranty - data recover is not covered under warranty. I’d rather have spent the 200$ I’ll be paying to recover the data on a drive that won’t have hardware fail (the head broke).
customer_reviews.author: mwayne

customer_reviews.title: I'm so disappointed.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this product in November 2016 and after storing my important files in it and a couple of saves, it suddenly stopped working. It's not powering up at all. I tried to plug it in my pc, laptop and printer and it is not recognized nor would it show up us plugged in. I bought it for the reasonable price and big storage and speed capacity but it is not worth it if it's defective. I'm so disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: grish

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY
customer_reviews.text: This product completely stopped working. It's always on my desk and I take it on travel a times. I'm super careful on how to plug it and unplug it, but now it won't be recognized. The design is poor. The plug area is now loose. DO NOT BUY. I'm done with SEAGATE FOREVER! This is my last attempt, I have to pay a little extra for something that works!!
customer_reviews.author: Carlos Cole

customer_reviews.title: Quit working after first use
customer_reviews.text: Pros: slim, portable, easy to set up, nice color Cons: it’s VERY fussy and will say it has been unplugged when the cord was barely nudged. The slightest movement and I get “The drive was not ejected properly!” This might be user error but I’ve never had an external drive do this. It completed my first back up with no issues, but that was it. Now I get “preparing back up” forever. Have tried walking away and letting it churn for hours, and it never completes the back up. Tomorrow I’ll get on the phone with support. Blah. Will update review if they wave a wand and fix it.
customer_reviews.author: Electric boogaloo

customer_reviews.title: This Backup Disk is Used! Maybe risky.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this backup external storage as a spare and so it’s been kept in my drawer unused for a while since purchased. Took it out today for needing to do some backup for my desktop and was surprised to find the storage was filled with files and folders with very “weird” file names. Like some X-rated movies kind of titles (no kidding!) Did not even dare to open any of these files and quickly reformatted the whole storage drive + virus/malware scan multiple times. Still a little unrest for using a backup storage in this condition when it was supposedly “New”.
customer_reviews.author: mR2

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY
customer_reviews.text: This cannot be recognized by any computer after one use. I put my pictures from my old Mac onto this hard drive because I didn't want thousands of pictures slowing down my new Mac. After loading them, not a single computer can even recognize the drive. Thankfully I didn't wipe out my old Mac yet and still have my pictures. This is junk. I have the 2 year warranty but there's no way I trust this thing. I'm just hoping I can get a refund. Completely faulty.
customer_reviews.author: Laney

customer_reviews.title: Dont' use their backup program!
customer_reviews.text: I was supposed to get two of these; not one. I gave the 5 star cuz it worked, but the backup software is pathetic; the dashboard freezes and you cannot stop a backup. If the backup is based on the attribute bit then the initial backup will be incomplete because many of todays software do not set the attribute upon installation. also, you cannot do other things on the computer because the backup slows the entire system to a hault!!! YOU CANNOT DO ANYTHING WHILE BACKUP IS RUNNING. MY laptop runs at 4.01GHz and processing should not slow because of poor backup software. it is a couple of months now and I still have hot received the second new drive.
customer_reviews.author: BigMan

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for what we needed
customer_reviews.text: I had just started looking at portable hard drives because my teen said he needed one for is PS4. THis happened the day before Prime Day, so the timing was perfect. I searched Prime deals for a hard drive and among others, this one appeared. The price was good and the storage was ample. Once taken out of the box it was pretty obvious how to connect it and the system took it over from there. He is now able to play his games again because he has the storage. I would definitely recommend. In fact, in hindsight, I should have also purchased one for photos, for myself. Next time :)
customer_reviews.author: T. Cagan

customer_reviews.title: Read the reviews for this product before purchasing.
customer_reviews.text: Material quality is good. Is pretty light weight for a 2T external hard drive. I didn't read all the reviews about this product, I seriously wished I did. Now I'm bashing myself because like some or most bad reviews submitted, this drive just went bad one day and hearing clicking and buzzing sounds. Did some research on this and it's the reader getting stuck on the disc. Well, I guess we get what we paid for. Used for storing files ranging from documents to photos and some backup for the computer, was used for not even a month. I am looking into a SSD now.
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: Two Seagate Drives Gone Within Less Than Two years
customer_reviews.text: The original Seagate I purchased through Amazon lasted 8 months before a small beeping sound began playing from the hard drive. I was able to use the Seagate warranty and they shipped me out another one. However, that external hard drive also succumbed to the same issue 10 months into using it. I am in medical school, so I would carry my drive in a separate anti-shock case. I used it for OneNote and other programs that took up a large portion of my laptop memory. The product was well taken care of (i.e. no drops). I do not recommend this drive, especially considering the high price. It's lack of reliability isn't worth it.
customer_reviews.author: wildcat14

customer_reviews.title: Guess I can't expect forever
customer_reviews.text: Used this drive as a backup for my MacBook Air that I use as a desktop when I sold my iMac. Therefore, the Seagate drive never leaves the desk and is always plugged into the laptop. The drive lasted 5 years, then I began getting multiple messages that the drive was not ejected properly. Won't show up in Disk Utility. It spins, but it's dead. Overall, pretty satisfied. Just surprised that 5 years went by so quickly! Fortunately, I had just ordered a WD Elements drive, so putting that one into service.
customer_reviews.author: RichWords

customer_reviews.title: Completely Useless Hunk of Junk
customer_reviews.text: I backed up some crucial files for my VirtualBox VM. It's the only time I used this drive and it's the only thing I put on this drive. I can retrieve NONE of the files for my VM from this brand-new Seagate Backup Plus. Thank goodness I made another backup on my trusty Passport external harddrive. This Seagate Backup Plus Slim 2TB Portable External Hard Drive USB 3.0 is an useless hunk of junk.
customer_reviews.author: PRD409

customer_reviews.title: A must for PS4 owners
customer_reviews.text: This was purchased to add more storage to my son's PS4 Slim. You have to have the PS4 format the drive before use. This takes less than 30 seconds. Once formatted, I moved all content from the PS4 over to the Backup Plus. This took about an hour. This whole installation couldn't be easier.
customer_reviews.author: Christian S.

customer_reviews.title: I liked the way Memeo Instant Backup worked so I bought ...
customer_reviews.text: I liked the way Memeo Instant Backup worked so I bought another Seagate product. Unfortunately, the software that this product uses, the "Seagate Dashboard Agent" or SDA for short, doesn't back up my files the way I would manually. It does the changes incrementally which is not at all to my tastes. Not only that, the SDA is for some reason absurdly slow to user input no matter what I do. Seagate needs to focus on the software because this is a two part product, the hardware, and the backup software that uses that hardware. Unfortunately, the hardware won out (hopefully to last a long time) and the software took a back seat.
customer_reviews.author: Sobe

customer_reviews.title: Warning - this is NOT an external hard drive
customer_reviews.text: Warning- this is NOT an external hard drive. Although the product description shows that it is an external hard drive, it cannot be used as an external drive (I do own another external hard drive so I know how it should function). I purchased this to transfer, save, and have access to digital photos. When connected to the computer the device does not appear as a drive. Instead, it begins transferring code. I assume it is backing up the entire computer system?? The product is worthless to me, sad waste of money as it appears to not be returnable. Hopefully I can at least be refunded the extended warranty that i purchased.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: My Mind -- and Data -- Are At Peace
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this portable hard drive recently when I realized my other one is almost ten years old. I just wanted to keep everything safe. I bought it based on its overall ratings and the reviews of it, which were very good and informative. It arrived very quickly and I love it. I was able to transfer just over 500GB in about 10 hours using a standard USB cord. It's fast and I have a lot of confidence in it. And that's exactly what I wanted. Plus, I now have even more room for stuff. If only closets and houses, in general, were as accommodating.
customer_reviews.author: K. Roberts

customer_reviews.title: The BEST Solution to Reliable Computer Backup
customer_reviews.text: Need a personal home backup? You can not find one much, if any better then this. It's easy to use and has a lot of space. The device, itself takes up very little space, itself! I use it, have it set for automatic backup, and it can be set to replicate the backup, even to one of several sites on the web. Much cheaper then paying for a "dedicated" on-line backup with a monthly fee. . .and you don't even control your own data, once you send it off! Wonderful little device, if you do backups, and you should, you really need one of these.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: No more Seagate for me
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had this for 3 years, i found it very confusing to manipulate. It filled up fast which made me think it was duplicating Files but when I tried to access it, all I got was codes, never got a file list. I’m not in the least tech savvy as you can tell from this review so didn’t follow up. Now I’m switching computers and of course can’t get anything off the drive so lost a lot of older important files. I had a Seagate previous to this one and had a similar experience. No more Seagate.
customer_reviews.author: Hapcity

customer_reviews.title: My first ever dead HDD
customer_reviews.text: I have been using computers for the last 24 years and this is the first time I had a hard drive fail, and not even that long into its life cycle. One day, it just completely fizzled out. Tech support is of little help. I personally tried replacing the chip board and doing all manner of jumps to try and get the drive to connect and be recognized without any luck. I still have old WD's over ten years old that continue to work like a charm. If you value your data, you will stay far away from this product.
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth M.

customer_reviews.title: The Library of my life on one drive for $100!
customer_reviews.text: Works very well. Plugs into my USB 3.0 port with provided cable and writes at > 100 MB/sec. Good size to put all my computer files in one backpack. Nice to have access to all my music while I travel for those days without free wifi. I purchased the Amazon Basics case and it fits fine and has a pouch for the cable. Great combo. Not much experience with Seagate but they're a good brand ... usually I go with Western Digital or Hitachi (now HSGT or Toshiba) for mechanical hard drives. I'll update if I experience a problem. Make sure to eject through Windows before moving this drive!
customer_reviews.author: pablo

customer_reviews.title: xbox one
customer_reviews.text: Is this compatible with an Xbox One? yes and no if you use it for games yes if you have media files (movies) xbox wont read all 4tbs of movies(half will work others wont on a 4tb version not sure about the 3tb version not test
customer_reviews.author: Tx GREMLIN xT

customer_reviews.title: Repaired my DOA HDD
customer_reviews.text: This product arrived DOA. To be honest I suspect it is a previously returned item. I decided my curiosity would win out over my desire to return this hdd. I took it a part and removed the sata to USB adaptor. I suspected that the adapter was the likely culprit causing this drive to fail to be identified. I was right. In making the drive usable I voided the warranty. If you are looking for an external hard drive you should probably look elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: Chuck

customer_reviews.title: Working good nearly after 2 years
customer_reviews.text: I bought this hard drive around 3 years ago to gift it to my friend. I kept it as is for about 1 year and then handed over to my friend after visiting him to the home country. It didn’t worked once started and then after contacting the customer care, they provided excellent service as it was under warranty. I am highly satisfied with their customer services. Since then, It’s been working perfectly fine as I recently asked my friend. It’s good product to consider for backup of your files and folders.
customer_reviews.author: Ranjit

customer_reviews.title: Seagate is quality
customer_reviews.text: Seagate is a name I've trusted for years. This is plug n play, as most devices are today. Works perfectly. When I need to transfer a file I just grab and drop the file onto the expansion icon and it adds it very quickly. With other brands I've read people complain about the noise their device makes when copying large files. Even when I'm backing up big chunks of my hard drive there is no sound at all. It's also very light-weight with a slim design. My only regret is I didn't buy the 4TB instead...one can never have enough backup.
customer_reviews.author: FaithfulMe

customer_reviews.title: Great product but look into SSDs first
customer_reviews.text: I gave this product five stars for portability even though I don’t bring up places but I have thought of and it fits great in bags of all shapes and sizes it is great for backing up my Mac but if you’re looking for a Seagate drive they just came out with new very pretty SSDs which are better quality than hard drives they can be more expensive for the same amount of storage space but I less likely to break Other than this I have not have any problems I would recommend buying but look into SSDs first.
customer_reviews.author: GKleck

customer_reviews.title: ordered and paid for silver, received black which already had
customer_reviews.text: i have several computers and several seagates; one for each and color code each to know them instantly. already had a black one for the black computer. have a blue for the blue computer. NEEDED A SILVER TO GO WITH THE SILVER COMPUTER, BUT INSTEAD RECEIVED THE BLACK. NOW, IN THE DESCRIPTION ON THE ORDER I PLACED, IT CLEARLY SPELLED OUT SILVER. SO THE ONE STAR IS JUST FOR THE WRONG ITEM SHIPPED. HAVE USED THE SEAGATES FOR YEARS AND THEY ARE THEY ONLY BACKUP I USED AND NEED. THE ONE STAR DOES NOT APPLY TO THE PRODUCT BUT THE WRONG ITEM RECEIVED.
customer_reviews.author: Snowbird

customer_reviews.title: Not reliable
customer_reviews.text: These things are not reliable. I've bought 13 over the past two years to use as rotating backup. Every so often I get an error writing files. Sometimes formatting will make them workable again. Other times, they become expensive paper weights. I've had this happen to five or six of them. Perhaps a low level format will help, but why bother? It doesn't give me any confidence to use as a backup.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Seems to be a good product. But not easy to determine how/ when ...
customer_reviews.text: Seems to be a good product. But not easy to determine how/ when backups are proceeding when connected to current (new) PC. Used with 'old' Dell to backup what was on there before replacing computer. Older PC did not have up to date browser, so when attempting 'auto' back thru Seagate interface, would not work, just dragged and dropped all pic/ music/ docs to external drive (manually), and hoped for the best. When connected to new PC, Seagate software interface kicked in and could step by step access backed up files and install on new PC. Pics/ music/ docs on new PC hard drive now...still, not easy to navigate...
customer_reviews.author: T. Wallace

customer_reviews.title: HD stops working after 1 yr
customer_reviews.text: Stopped working in 1 yr. I never carried it around. I never dropped it. It stayed plugged in to my PC. Then all of a sudden a beeping sound and ny computer stopped recognizing it. When I called customer service they said I had to erase everything off my HD and it would work again?... wow. Lol I just lost all of my data from the HD. Should of backed it up. But anyways it still is under warranty and these Seagate is telling me it still works. I dont want an HD that will randomly stop working.
customer_reviews.author: James Acosta

customer_reviews.title: Acer Chromebook
customer_reviews.text: Avoid for use with crhomebook. Worked just fine first time plugging it in. 2nd time, I plug it in and it doesn't register. Product support is only open until 5 pm eastern so had to wait for a day off to call. Finally call and they only are trained how to support MAC or WINDOWS. If you google this product its advertised as great for chromebooks yet they don't even support it. Now I'm out $70 and all the photos I put on this crappy drive.
customer_reviews.author: Justin

customer_reviews.title: Fast 100MB/sec but Twice likely to fail with 2 HDD inside....
customer_reviews.text: This is qty 2 of 2TB HDD's at RAID0 inside. Advantage: It's able to sustain 100MB/sec instead of usual 40MB/sec for regular 2.5" USB HDD. Drawback: Twice as likely to fail, because it has two HDD instead of just one inside. Does not matter to me, I use these things purely for backup and put them in storage, so I appreciate the USB3 speeds and NO POWER ADAPTER REQUIRED AT ALL. Overall for my uses it gets 5 stars for performance, cost per GB, no power adapter, small size.
customer_reviews.author: blogthis

customer_reviews.title: 1.5 years later, still running strong!
customer_reviews.text: I've owned this external HD for a while now, and I'm super paranoid about these things getting corrupted and failing on me. However I'm happy to say this one has still remained stable. However the cable it comes with can cause problems, make sure you keep it unplugged from the actual HD when not in use. As they wear out, the laptop has difficulty detecting it.
customer_reviews.author: Cyrone

customer_reviews.title: Piece of Crap!!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this 11/17. Now it started beeping and then died. What is the point of having a backup drive that dies? Even when it was working, half the time it wouldn't back up my computer. DO NOT BUY THIS. INVEST in something more expensive!!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: it failed.... died. less then 6 months
customer_reviews.text: UPDATED REVIEW: less then 6 months and it died, apparently one of the disk died left with 2tb working.... have to send in for replacement and causes me so much troubles.... please commend if you saw a spike of dead seagates...... it got a near 3.5 inch speed, and it got a true 3.5 inch capacity, less heat, no power adapter, seem like this is what we would be using today, working perfectly for a month now, and looking forward for another gold box sale to get another. got it at around 159 usd, what else could i ask for.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Tan

customer_reviews.title: Works Great!
customer_reviews.text: I love these....I have about 5 of them....I only buy on sale, about $80USD( The Black one is only $70 today, $35/TB). Of course, technology changes very quickly. As soon as the 4TB version is reduced in size and at the same price point, I will replace them. As I write this the Black 4TB version is only $110 or $27/TB, very good deal :-) I never use the Seagate Backup/Utility software. I delete it as soon as I get it. I use these to store all of my media to be played using XBMC/KODI media-centre.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher S Heeney

customer_reviews.title: 5years of photography down the drain
customer_reviews.text: I bought this February 2018 to back up my photographs because my laptop was getting full. I didn’t even use half the drive yet and suddenly my laptop can’t read it. I’ve never dropped it nor do I travel with it. It sits safely in my desk drawer. I had backed up all my photos into this drive and now I’ve lost it all. DO NO BUY.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer c

customer_reviews.title: Be very afraid!
customer_reviews.text: I put this on my computer for back up. The installation was very easy. The problem came the next day when I had set it up to back up daily. Once it did it's first back up on it's own it made my computer act like it had a virus. The only thing it would do is show me a flashing white line in the top left corner. When I tried to do a ctrl/alt/del it acted like it was starting to boot up but then would go back to the flashing line. Once I unplugged it the computer went back to normal operation. I don't trust it and definitely will NOT be leaving it attached.
customer_reviews.author: Bassinator

customer_reviews.title: Drive not accessible
customer_reviews.text: Not sure if I received a bad drive or what but each time I connect it to my laptop I have to disconnect and reconnect several times before it is readable. This has been ongoing since the very first time I used it. Now disconnecting and reconnecting it is not working; keep getting the error "drive is not accessible" The file or directory is corrupted or unreadable. This is very frustrating!! Now I'm at a lost without my files.
customer_reviews.author: msfinni

customer_reviews.title: Great drive. I purchased one about a year ago ...
customer_reviews.text: Great drive. I purchased one about a year ago for myself and have had no problems. Transfer speeds are nice and it stays cool. My wife needed to get videos and picks off her cell phone and since I love mine so much I decided to purchase the exact same one for her. I love the fact that you can hook this up to a Samsung Galaxy 6S and Note 5 (will need to purchase a micro USB 2.0 OTG cable) to transfer files straight from the phone.
customer_reviews.author: E34felix

customer_reviews.title: The accompanying software, OneTouch, severely limits the capabilities!
customer_reviews.text: The drive itself seems fine. HOWEVER, OneTouch software does not allow you to change the backup settings such that you can make it back up what you desire! It forces you into a subset of files/folders and does not allow you to choose anything outside of that subset. For example, it does not allow you to backup your AppData folder, which can contain things such as your Outlook Data File (PST). The workaround, of course, is to manually create a folder on the backup drive and then use windows explorer to copy the data from the computer's drive to the backup drive.
customer_reviews.author: Allen Hall

customer_reviews.title: Works with my media server
customer_reviews.text: I like these small footprint drives. It works well for me as storage for my media server. I have over 2,700 TV shows and 350 movies and still have free space on the drive. I also like the fact that it's USB powered so I don't have to run another wire to supply power to it. I've also found that I can stream up to three devices from this drive without any frame rate loss or buffering. I highly recommend this external hard drive for what ever your needs may be..
customer_reviews.author: Blair Wooten

customer_reviews.title: Works great. Skip the included software.
customer_reviews.text: Plug it in and drag and drop your files to backup. No set-up needed. Don't bother with the confusing and limited software that is included or the manufacturer's website. You'll just get more confused. Remember, this is for backups or temp storage. Don't have this as the sole source for your files. Get Amazon's carrying pouch for this or keep it stored in the box it came in. And treat it gently as you would any electronic device and you'll have no problems.
customer_reviews.author: Peter K.

customer_reviews.title: Works great for Xbox One
customer_reviews.text: After seeing mention that Xbox Live's Major Nelson used this drive for his Xbox One I bought one of my own and have not disappointed. Over several months I have used this as the primary drive for downloading and playing games on my Xbox One and it has performed flawlessly. In the past I've used Seagate drives for computers, both internal and external, and never been disappointed. On my recommendation a friend bought his own for his Xbox One and has had an identical experience. This is a great hard drive.
customer_reviews.author: Definitely dot-dot-dot Useful

customer_reviews.title: Fortunately I had backed up this hard drive but still ...
customer_reviews.text: Beware!!!! My Seagate External Hard Drive was just under a year old when it crashed. According to the Seagate customer support person I chatted with hard drives have moving parts and are subject to failure. He said it is unpredictable---he sees some that last 10 years and some that last only a year. Fortunately I had backed up this hard drive but still lost quite a bit of recent work. The lesson here is to be sure to routinely back up all your data to other locations---especially anytime you have done any major project.
customer_reviews.author: rharring

customer_reviews.title: Be careful
customer_reviews.text: I used as alternative swap with WD 3 TB similar drive. WD was a year older, now a year longer after the Seagate failed. Just whirred to a stop one day. Seagate used to be the absolute best, and I go back to Apple Mac 8600/9600 towers, where you could add up to five HD. Seagate was built like a tank. Saw no purpose in turning to their service techs. Crushed it to make sure no recovery possible. Turned to bus-run SSDs. Smaller. More expensive. No platters.
customer_reviews.author: Lloyd Smith

customer_reviews.title: 3 out of 4 Seagate external drives have died on me. Never buying Seagate again.
customer_reviews.text: Drive failed after only 4 months of very light use. Plugging it into any USB port on any computer with any USB 3.0 cable results in two beeps and the light won't come on. At least this drive died soon enough so it's still under warranty...but that means the warranty will send me another Seagate drive which I won't trust. So far 3 out of 4 of these drives have failed on me. Never buying Seagate again.
customer_reviews.author: Avai D'Amico

customer_reviews.title: Who knew we'd get this far?
customer_reviews.text: I can recall getting excited about having 256K drives! I'm a Mac person and when I received this, I followed all the instructions including getting the insurance to protect the data. STOP!! You don't have to go through all that convolution unless you're transferring between Mac and PC platforms. I found that I couldn't even get data from other Macs unless you downloaded the software onto that other Mac too! If you're on a Mac, just reformat through disk utility! Note: hardly any support from Seagate! Good product though.
customer_reviews.author: Couplewords

customer_reviews.title: HardDrive failed with in a month of receiving it.
customer_reviews.text: I have two of these hard drives. One I bought about a year ago that works fine. This one I used to back up my lap top. Probably used it only 4 or 5 times. I have had it for less than a month and now I can not read it on any computer. Tried three different ones. Wit no luck. Since I was out of town I missed the return deadline by 4 days. Now ordering a different hard drive to get everything off the older Seagate before it goes too.
customer_reviews.author: R. Berr

customer_reviews.title: Great Hard Drive To Own
customer_reviews.text: I just realized that I have owned this hard drive for near 3 years and I have had 0 issues with it. Its mainly used for photos and docs. In 3 years it isn't even half way full so clearly we don't save TONS of stuff on it but it has been more helpful than having several flash drives or loading up our computer. I cannot tell you how tech support is because we have not had to use them yet. We also do not run this things 24/7 but it is plugged in a lot.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: Not a reliable product
customer_reviews.text: I have had this drive for just over a month and it quit making backups. Customer service was easy to reach, but they could not solve the problem after over 1 hour on the phone. One thing customer service did not have me try was to delete the “ToolKit” software and reinstall which I did following my discussion with CS. I also removed all previous backup files from the drive. After uninstalling and reinstalling “ToolKit” the drive is working again, for how long is anyone’s guess. After this experience I do not have confidence that this product will work as it should.
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: Unusual Noises Coming From Device
customer_reviews.text: The first red one I got made a constant ticking noise whenever it was plugged it. I tried it on two different computers and had the same issue. I exchanged it for another red one and have a similar issue, except instead of a ticking noise, there's a loud humming noise. I've had the exact same model hard drive in black from over 2.5 years now and it never made those ticking and humming noises.
customer_reviews.author: Victoria
